message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.SI, cs.IT

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of minimizing the size of an iBGP overlay in an Autonomous System (AS) in the Internet, which is a networking problem and falls under the category of Networked and Distributed Systems (cs.NI). The paper also introduces a new connectivity-based network design problem called Constrained Connectivity, which involves finding the smallest subgraph of a given graph that connects every pair of vertices based on a set of constraints. This problem is related to graph theory and combinatorial optimization, and falls under the categories of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) and Computational Geometry (cs.CG). The paper also discusses approximation algorithms and hardness results, which are related to the field of Theoretical Computer Science (cs.TH) and Information Theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper includes simulations on actual topologies of five large Autonomous Systems, which falls under the category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
